intro: Aciotis paludosa var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf marsh fleabane, is a herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It features slender, hairy stems that often grow in dense clusters, and its leaves are broad, lance-shaped, and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in moist soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Due to its adaptability to wet environments, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
